name: Hotel Regina Barcelona

reviews.text: We are in the midst of a three night stay at this comfortable, classy, family-friendly hotel. Staff is attentive without being at all intrusive. The bar/lounge area is the perfect spot for reading/checking e-mail while enjoying a glass of wine or cool drink after a long day of sightseeing. Yesterday I had to file a story on a tight deadline and I couldn't have asked for a more perfect environment. The family room is spacious and well-appointed. What I love most about Hotel Regina is that it retains a funky charm--nothing sterile or homogenized. Of course, the real draw is the perfect location--we can walk down La Rambla to the port, through the Gothic Quarter and back, take the Hop-on, Hop-off bus (stops virtually in front of the hotel) or catch the Metro within a one-minute walk. Highly recommended when you come to this beautiful city.
reviews.title: Perfection in Playa Catalunya

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here prior to a cruise and were completely satisfied. It has a great location, less than a block from Placa de Catalunya, close to the Ramblas and a short walk to the Gothic Quarter as well as easy accessto the metro(less than a block). Our room was ready when we got there at 10:00 am, and on the day we left they offered to hold our bags for us after we checked out if we wanted to go sightseeing without them. (We didn't use this service, but it was nice to know that if we stay there again, we can leave our bags if our room isn't ready.)
reviews.title: Perfect Pre-Cruise Stay

reviews.text: The room was small which didn't matter a bit as it was perfectly clean and comfortable with a queen sized bed and a beautiful view which was just an added bonus. The bathroom amenities were higher quality than your run-of-the-mill standard and the bathroom was quite nice with green marble. The blackout curtains worked completely, and there was a flat screen LCD tv that we didn't use much. Wireless internet is free and easy to access. We enjoyed our stay here completely and would stay here again if ever in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and a fabulous location

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my partner and another couple. We took a long time to select our hotel via the internet and eventually plumped for this hotel because of the location. It was at the higher end of our price range but we were very pleased with the location and the service we recieved. We stayed for three nights at the beginning of May. On our arrival the gentleman at the reception desk gave us a friendly welcome and recommended some attractions and restaurants at our request. Our rooms were spacious and clean with balconies to the front of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable and the room was extremely dark at night with only a small hum of the metro beneath so we had no problem with sleep. I actually had to leave the bathroom light on because I'm not used to pitch black at home. The location of the hotel is directly off the main square Placa de Catalunya where you can easily get a taxi back to the airport and jump on the Bus turistic tour. The bus tour can be booked through the hotel for a discount price. You pay 4 euros each at reception and then get 6 euros off the price in the kiosk in the square. So a you get a saving of 2 euros each over the two days. We didn't use the hotel breakfast facillities as we initially thought the price was high, but after venturing out into the town we would probably use the hotel if we went to Barcelona again. The food was very expensive. Although in the end we did enjoy a breakfast at the Happy grill near the hotel that was a reasonable price. Overall we would definately recommend the hotel to others and would stay here again if we went back to Barcelona. (rooms 204 & 205)
reviews.title: Great hotel!! - but watch out for Dereck
Great Location
reviews.text: I really enjoyed my stay at Htoel Regina...the rooms were lovely and clean and most of the staff were really helpful, apart from one man DERECK...me and my mate stayed in a room together...and he laughed at us presuming we were homosexual....me and my friend felt very uncomfortable.... we asked DERECK where a good place to go on a night out was - we would have been better asking the plantpot.....he directed us to a ghost town...Loved Hotel Regina and Barcelona is one of the most fantastic places in the worl...but watch out for DERECK!!!!

I have to say that I had very high expectations of Regina especially after reading some of the reviews on Tripadvisor...While it is true that the hotel is perfectly located (just off the Ramblas )and the rooms were clean and nicely decorated, I was very disappointed when I first entered the hotel....
reviews.title: Clean comfortable and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we first arrived at the hotel, it felt like we had just walked into a cheap hotel. The first thing we saw when we entered the lobby doors was the elevator with a gray wooden ramp in front of it, the dark reception desk to the left with one sofa and a large dining table to the right which looked so out of place... Where was the beautifully decorated lobby I had seen on the photos online...Well...you do not actually see that portion of the lobby until you go around the corner towards the bar area....
reviews.title: Great location lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the lobby did not bother us that much after the first day, I wanted to mention this as I wanted to set the expectations right for future guests who are expecting to walk into a stylishly decorated hotel...
reviews.title: Great location Great Hotel

reviews.text: The Quadruple room that we had was perfect for a family with 2 adults and 2 teenagers. There were 2 twin beds in the main area and 2 single beds in an alcove close to the window....The room was large for European standards, was tastefully decorated and was clean.
reviews.title: Perfect location and very accommodating to families with young children

reviews.text: We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as I felt 16 euros per person or 64 euros for 4/day was too expensive to pay for breakfast. But there is a Starbucks right next door and a grocery store across the road.... which was perfect.
reviews.title: "WOW" what a great stay in barcelona

reviews.text: Our family of 9 ( 7 adults and 2 children) just returned from our wonderful 7 night stay at the Hotel Regina, Barcelona. The hotel is located 2 minutes from Plaza Catalunya and could not be in a better location to get around the city. We got the airport bus in which leaves you off outside the Corte Ingles right opposite the street the hotel is on. When we arrived, check in was quick and the staff could not be more helpful. They gave us a family room for 4, a triple room for 3 and a superior double which also had an extra partition with a bed in it. The rooms all had bottles of champagne, large bathrooms with 2 sinks and lots of toiletries. The beds were huge and very comfortable and each room had a 32 inch plasma screen. We asked for rooms on the first floor and they were all located together so it was like having your own little section of the hotel. I contacted the manager who is also manager of the award winning Hotel Pultzier which is next door and we were also able to use their amenities too. The manager arranged for us to have rooms plus breakfast, which turned out to be the best choice and well worth the extra money. It was a buffet breakfast with a variety of breads/ croissants/ cakes/ cheeses/juices/ cereals/ tortillas/ fresh fruit and salads and more.. The staff were extremely helpful, in particular Lucila who heled us get concert tickets. The food in the hotel is really good and reasonably priced and the bar staff make sure everything is perfect for you. For some of the group, it was our 2nd time in Barcelona and it was even better this time around. before we stayed in Barceloneta beside the beach which is a bit of a trek into the city centre. Everything is within walking distance of Hotel Regina and it really helps when you have somewhere luxurious to come back to when you have had a long day playing the tourist. I would 100% reccommend this hotel and Barelona to any traveller.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel, will return

reviews.text: Have just returned from a 2 night stay, and thoroughly enjoyed it. The location of this hotel is perfect. It's right in the centre of the city, so a perfect starting point to explore. And also very easy to get back to - all types of transport are right outside.
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived, the staff were very helpful and efficient. The room was an unusual shape but an acceptable size. The beds were comfy.
reviews.title: This is your hotel !!!

likes.disliked: — Staff at bar very nice, but not too friendly

reviews.text: Our only complaint was being located right next to the infamous housekeeping cupboard, and therefore heard every door open and close as the staff went about their work in the early hours. To be fair, we didn't mention this to management, as we were only there for 2 nights and didn't want the hassle of changing our room. The staff were very helpful in letting us store our luggage after checking out, for nearly a whole day. Also, no free wine or chocolates in the room, as others have noted.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: We felt safe and secure in and outside the hotel at all times, which was nice, being 2 females.
reviews.title: Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night at the end of a 3 week trip to Spain. Staff at the reception desk were helpful with any requests or questions. However, I had booked a double room in advance, and confirmed it was a double at check-in, but when I got to the room, it was a twin. When I phoned reception to see what was going on, they told me that a booking for a double room is only treated as a REQUEST for a double. Huh??? Hotel Regina & I obviously have different concepts of what a confirmed booking is. They did find a double room for me, so it was all fine after that.
reviews.title: Perfectly adequate

reviews.text: Free internet access in the business centre near the hotel bar was great.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I don't have any complaints about the hotel, but nor is it one I would rave about. Perfectly adequate sums it up.
reviews.title: No problems for me at the Hotel Regina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in a triple room for two nights with two girlfriends on a city break. The location is perfect in a quiet road set just off the main square with metro stations everywhere.
reviews.title: Disappointing experience

reviews.text: Reception staff were wonderful, very helpful and happy to reccomend restaurants if you let them know what you are looking for (eg. typical catalan within walking distance). We did not have breakfast at the hotel as 16euro per person seemed overpriced and there are plenty of wondeful cafes in the area.
reviews.title: Great Location in a very comfortable hotel.

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel regina for 3 nights in May with my 2 children. We ended up staying here by default due to a problem with the aircon in our original hotel. ( See review on Casa Camper).
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: The transfer was handled beautifully.From the moment we arrived things looked up. There is an air of understated elegance as you enter which is most relaxing after the bustle of the outside world. The manager appeared from the sister hotel next door to welcome us, bedraggled and bereft of sleep, and we were shown to our room. Unfortunately, we did not get the cava and chocolates that other reviewers have mentioned, but I suspect that it was simply the nature of our arrival that resulted in this ommission!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was light, airy, spacious and, most importantly, the aircon worked! The room had a relaxed contemporary feel, anhanced by the simple colour scheme. The bathroom was somewhat small, but adequate. The alcove for the sofa bed was fine. Television, mini bar, safe, toiletries were all present. There was plety of storage space. We found the beds to be comfortable and slept reasonably well- except for the noise outside. Having complained in the previous hotel we had stayed in, I was slow to make a big deal here- but I would recommend travellers to request a quiet room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff, Great Room!

likes.liked: — It was exactly what was pictured and described, modern, clean, large bathroom, sound proof windows

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
reviews.text: Breakfast was super. The selection was very good- and though one could not get eggs, omelletes etc cooked to order, there was plenty to choose from...Breads, rolls, toast, fruits, yogurts, croissants,pastries, caprese salad, cold meats,cheeses, scrambled eggs, sausages and sauteed potatoes, teas coffee, juice....essentially a very good choice. The breakfast room itself was light and airy and offered views on 2 sides of the streets outside; so one could just eat breakfast and watch the world go by.

The location of this hotel is second to none- 2 minutes from the Placa Catalunya, where the tour buses leave; and 2 minutes from Las Ramblas pedestrian street. Taxis are easy to get if you want to travel farther afield.
reviews.title: Reasonable rates...great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here in May we had an extended holiday due to volcanic ash so ended up booking Hotel Regina.
reviews.title: VERY PLEASANT AND WELCOMING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is a lovely hotel and the rooms had everything in you could possibly need down to toiletories, slippers, bathrobes ladies and men's wash kits it has all the special touches you stay in a hotel for. Staff and reception staff are very friendly and will do anything to help you out we had a great experience of this due to the circumstances of our flights being cancelled.
reviews.title: Nice old Hotel in a great location

reviews.text: It is in a great safe location minutes walk from everything where its happening.
reviews.title: Very convenient centrally situated hotel

reviews.text: We would definatly stay here again thanks Regina :0)
reviews.title: Nice but Noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here on our way through Barcelona and couldn't fault the facilities or the service. The building is old but very well equipped and the price was excellent for the location. The service was faultless (I stuffed up the booking and our flight also got delayed - in both cases the Hotel assisted us, in English). We will certainly stay here again when are lucky enough to return to beautiful Spain.
reviews.title: Two fabulous stays--surpassed our expectations!
Hotel Regina - a lovely place to stay
reviews.text: Note to light sleepers! The walls are pretty thin and you can hear even the slightest activity outside your door. But, this is understandable given the age of the building.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Regina is in a fantastic location, just off La Rambla and the Placa del Catalonya. It is next door to the Pulitzer Hotel and has the same manager. I was there for 5 days in April 2008.
reviews.title: Cool hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: I had requested a room on a higher floor, away from the elevators and maid storage room, with a balcony. I received exactly what I had requested. The hotel provides all guests with a complimentary bottle of cava and a box of dessert chocolates - a very nice touch.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed with friends for a long weekend in early April. The Hotel is ideally located and within a short walk of the Bus Stop for the airport bus. Tip pay the bus driver dont queue at the machine to pre purchase your ticket - the wait is too long! the hotel is located done a side road and therefore just far enough away from the noise and hutsle and bussle. Rooms are cosy and very clean. You can feel/hear the rumble of the Metro underground but seems fairly general across the City and was certainly not enough to disturb our stay. You must try the market off of las ramblas it is a real experience. We stayed for three days which was not long enough and another two days would have been nice to have explored further. we will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Great Location
lovely hotel
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights at the regina on the strenght of reviews here, we were not disapointed. We had room210 a large corner room very clean comfortable, and noise free. The location is brilliant as is beautiful barcelona !!! I would have liked to have tea or coffe making available in the room.I found the wash basins outside of the shower to be a great idea.

We had a lovely meal in the attic on las ramdlas would highly recommend it.The bar in the hotel is VERY QUIET perhaps alittle more life and upbeat music would encourage people to stay longer . I would recomment this hotel to all my friends, and starbucks was next door.
reviews.title: Great location, great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hotel Regina for two weeks in February while on a business trip and was extremely pleased with the overall experience. As an American who speaks very little Spanish (and certainly no Catalan), I was put at ease by the staff who spoke very good English and were extremely accomodating. Both the front desk and bar staff called taxis on a moment's notice, filled all requests for needs in a timely manner and were very helpful with directions and providing local information about transportation, restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: A little gem in a diamond city
Excellent place to stay......
reviews.text: The room was modern, comfortable and included most of the usual ammenities (no coffee maker). Hairdryer was not very powerful and there was no iron (but desk provided one upon request). Unfortunately, my room was next to the maid's closet, close to the elevator, and view was of a small airshaft (from which I could hear the people in the same room on other floors when my windows were open). I believe it was room # 12 (212, 312, etc). If you get this room I would suggest moving as it is very noisy. I am returning in April and the front desk suggested I book a room at the front of the building.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Read about the Hotel Regina on TripAdvisor (everyone had given rave reviews) and decided to stay there between 20th and 22nd May,2010. Beautiful place and very elegantly furnished with large bed and bathrooms. Immaculately kept and quita a value for money. Just outside the hotel the Hop On-Hop off tourist buses start at Plaza Catalunya. The AeroBus also operates from here and makes the hotel a very convenient place to stay for people like us, on a very short visit to Barcelona. High-speed internet is very good.
reviews.title: Great hotel, just off Plaza Catalunya and cinvenient for a tourist

reviews.text: Me and my husband with 2 children stayed at the regina Hotel for 4 nights in June 2010. The location of the hotel is truly great indeed since the easy access to all the sights. Yet, the sound isolation was worst ever: we felt like our room neighbors actually lived in our room and I believe they felt so about us as well. My 6yr old daughter even waked up at night when our room neighbors returned from a party at night as she thought somebody had come into our room (and here I am totally ok and respectful to people spending their time as they wish). The walls/doors require serious improvement because if staying at this hotel you will hear every last fart of your neighbor.
reviews.title: Excellent location, yet worst sound isolation

reviews.text: This hotel has obviously seen better days, but the location is great. The rooms are neat and clean but worn. The shower leaked. The metro and rail lines run near/under thehotel so you hear and feel the vibration starting at 0500. However, the windows facing the street have been improved to minimize the traffic noise. The service staff was fantastic.
reviews.title: great location!

reviews.text: You cannot beat the location of this hotel. Just off Las Ramblas - less than a minute walk but not right on Las Ramblas so it is much quieter. Close to the major metro stations and a short walk to Passeig de Gracia. The rooms were decent sized, nice comfortable beds, hardwood floors and big bathrooms. Beware, the shower is a little bizarre and sometimes it felt like a fight to get it to not spray all over over the bathroom. The staff was nice but not very helpful - incorrect directions to the train station, poor restaurant recommendations and varying distances to major locations depending on who you asked. There is a business center with a few computers and free Internet access.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms

reviews.text: Tip - there are not clocks in the room so bring your own alarm/clock
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed at the Regina for two nights in late June. We had a double room, (2 beds), our children and grandchildren had a quad room (4 beds). The hotel is right off Plaza Catalyuna and the main thoroughfare Las Ramblas. It was quiet (except for the night that Spain won the world cup), the rooms were modern, clean and beautiful. Bathrooms were crisp and clean. The complimentary bathrobes were a plus. Their small bar is quiet and perfect to relax in after a day of sightseeing. They will arrange for sandwiches and small meals upon request. The internet is free, with 3 provided computers. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, answering our questions and providing taxi calls and restaurant recommendations. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms fairly large. Although not inexpensive, it compares very favorably with any 4 star hotel in New York City...indeed the rooms are larger and cleaner. We would be happy to use this hotel again.
reviews.title: Hotel Regina is a superior hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first trip to Barcelona and I chose the Hotel Regina for our stay. From the initial communication with the hotel's gracious manager, José Mª Sanchez, through our checkout, the experience was outstanding.
reviews.title: Outstanding

likes.liked: — The Staff is fantastic and the location cannot be beat.
likes.disliked: — The interior room we had on our second visit while comfortable was quite small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property is located just off the Placa Catalunya which provides VERY easy access from the airport. Hop on the A-1 bus (blue) and in just minutes you are there walking a short distance to the hotel (look for the blue banner on the side of the building).
reviews.title: Loved the Regina!

reviews.text: Having arrived in the morning I was quite pleased after the long flight that our room was available upon arrival and check-in was very pleasant and efficient. Our 5th floor room was spacious, contemporary and very comfortable (pictures posted) and the bathroom was good sized. As previously reported here, the bedding is very comfortable.
reviews.title: avoid room 502

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of rhe property is fantastic for visiting the city sites as it is an easy walk to the historic areas and La Rambla. Also, the Bus Turistic (hop on hop off service) launches from the Placa Catalunya so gettting around the city from the hotel is very, very easy.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel

reviews.text: I have been meaning to write this review for awhile and am just now getting around to it. I stayed at the Best Western Regina for two nights prior to a transatlantic cruise. It was my second choice and I have never been so pleased.
reviews.title: A Great Little Hotel

likes.disliked: — Inability of front desk to convert currency or cash travellers cheques

reviews.text: The hotel sits on a street not far from Las Ramblas in an old building that has been redecorated in modern European style.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room, while not large was attractively decorated and had french doors leading to a Juliet balcony overlooking the street. As far as I was concerned this was worth the cost of admission. The bed was comfortable and in a alcove and out of the way. There were great Bath amenities and the Bathroom was good sized and well appointed. I still don't get the glass half door thing on the tub, but there you go. There is a great bar although one night it was full of unpleasant americans (and I am an American) and a decent restaurant in the sister hotel next door. I had breakfast that came with the meal and the breakfast was excellent and the room attractive
reviews.title: Fantastic
Very Happy with this Hotel ...
reviews.text: The location is great near the main plaza, Las Ramblas and El Corte Angles (great department store) is nearby. There is a tourist bus stop across the way. I found it conveniant to walk to many things. A few caveats (which would not keep me from going back) Several times early in the AM someone would rattle the room door And the staff while friendly and efficient was unable to cash a travellers cheque or convert currency which I found odd.
That said this hotel was a find and cost about 140Euros which I felt was a deal
reviews.title: A great stay

description: The four-stars Regina Hotel in Barcelona, is full of charm and is highlighted by a combination of timeless elegance, contemporary design and its central location, in a quiet street, close to Paseo de Gracia, Plaza Cataluña and Las Ramblas. The modern spirit with a classic twist is reflected in both the 99 comfortable rooms and the lobby, where the simplicity of forms and the use of noble raw materials create an intimate and relaxing environment.
